Reviews.Title: “Hidden away and far away”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: My brother, his wife, my buddy and I stayed here during our road trip through Italy in May '09. Venice was our first stop in Italy after driving down from Munich. We drove down and used GPS to be able to find this place. We arrived late in the evening and had a little bit of trouble finding the place cause it was hidden behind another building on the main street. We almost drove away till I saw the sign for the hotel and decided to walk down a small narrow street and confirmed that the hotel was indeed back there. Had my brother park in their parking lot and then we all went inside to check in. The exterior of the hotel looks like something from the 70s and it is not close to any train station so heading into town is not easy. We drove over the bridge and parked at one of the parking structures on the island. Entering the lobby, there is a feel of a luxurious hotel out of the 80s, luckily without the 80s colors. Lots of black through. The check-in process was easy and we got our keys to separate rooms. My buddy and I shared a double room with 2 full size beds. The room was just large enough to fit both beds and a large dresser with a TV. The bathroom was also just large enough. Everything about the room seemed to be simple but elegant. Nothing overdone, but nothing cheap looking. The beds, pillows, linens, and towels were all comfy and clean. For the price, we enjoyed our stay although as my sister-in-law pointed out, the neighborhood looked like some rundown places back home. Next time we'll see if we can make advanced reservations for a place on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Very average and boring hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALMI64
Reviews.Content: It is not in Venice but in Mestre. rooms are tiny, service is indifferent and it is not really a place to offer you a memorable experience. Rather cheap though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, elegant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: crazyfornaples
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise for the reasonable price we paid. Very clean, comfortable, decent size, soundproof rooms, great breakfast and a lovely garden outside! Very close to the pedestrian center of Mestre with lots of shops and cafes and close to bus stop into Venice. Staff was very friendly and helpful with information. Not far from the airport taxi's bring you and your luggage. Perfect place to stay while sightseeing Venice without the hassel of carrying luggage into Venice. Ten minute ride to the crluise port. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: NickPaphos123
Reviews.Content: My family and I were relocated to the hotel Michelangelo after having a problem with our previous hotel. I was very thankful. The hotel is reasonably price and is located in a fantastic location. It is walking distance to MANY restaurants and cafes. Bus stops outside takes you directly into Venice. This hotel is a winner

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful except the outdated a/c.”
Reviews.Author: tybeegirlOhio
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms, 2 doubles, 1 single and we stayed 3 nights. The rooms were large and updated. The bathrooms were a nice size with a separate tub. The beds were comfortable and the linens nice. Beds were two twins together. The staff is very helpful and speak very good English. The lobby is spacious and the bar is very nice. The bartender was wonderful and even ordered a take out pizza for one of the couples that was not feeling well. He delivered it himself and brought them a beer as well! The hotel is located in Mestre, outside of Florence. We purchased a two day bus pass and a two day water taxi pass. The bus stop is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. It takes about 15 minutes to get to the water taxi station. Depending on where you are going from there, you could wait up to 20 minutes for the public water taxi. The hotel is located near restaurants and shopping on a main street. The breakfast choices were extensive and very good. The only drawback to this hotel is the a/c. We happened to be there during a very hot spell, over 90 F every day. We could not get the rooms cooled down. It made it uncomfortable to sleep. The hotel was very apologetic but it appears that the system is too small to cool the rooms when it is very hot. The hotel mgr stated they would be replacing the a/c system this winter. The hotel staff arranged a free land taxi to a private water taxi that took us to Murano Island at no cost to us. I believe there is some sort of agreement with the shops encouraging you to purchase crystal there. Either way, it was nice. You do have to pay to get back to Venice. We also went to Burano which has lace and was very colorful.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: mariamusic
Reviews.Content: I think we were very lucky that we chose to stay there for our trip to Venice. Regarding that we had very bad luck in Florence, our stay there was a relief. We arrived very late almost midnight and they were there waiting for us. Very helpful to everything we needed all through our stay. Very good breakfast till quite late and very good quality of beddings. Nice design of the rooms. Very convenient for travelling to the canals, since there was a direct bus going quickly to the boat area, leaving outside the hotel. Big parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close to Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: KSandZH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while visiting Venice. Bus stop for bus to Venice (10 minute trip) is 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Would recommend purchasing a 12 hour (16 euros) or 24 hour (18? euros) bus/boat pass from reception at the hotel. It is good for the bus to Venice as well as the water bus all around Venice. Room was very clean, bed was comfortable, AC worked well, bathroom had shower only, free secure parking on the premises.. Shopping center, local restaurants, and a movie theater all within 10 minutes walking distance. We were able to catch a movie (The Town) at the theater in Mestre that was part of the Venice International Film Festival that was ongoing while we were there. A very good breakfast was served from 7 until 11 each morning. One female waitress was very friendly and welcoming, but the other was very grumpy and could use some training in the area of customer service. All other staff (reception and cleaners) were friendly and helpful. Free high speed internet would have made our stay perfect, but it cost 5 euros/hour or 12.90 euros/24 hours. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at Michelangelo and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A joy to revisit,”
Reviews.Author: Gra3ham
Reviews.Content: very relaxing, good social atmosphere around the bar, the staff are friendly and I'm always greated as a friend returning. Rooms may seem a bit dark for some. I have stayed there many times over the past 5 years.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: LenaPerth
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 year old daughter and I simply walked in and asked if they had a room for 1 or 2 nights. (Our cruise from Venice was cancelled due to the ship hitting a reef, so we had to find accommodation until our new cruise left!) We found this hotel after almost giving up hope when turned down by almost 10 hotels. There was a huge art festival in the city and everyone was booked out. It was our luck then to get a 4 star hotel at half price for the night! It was a very modern hotel with a bath and was a very quiet room- double glazed windows. Don't let the busy road nearby scare you- we heard nothing! The breakfast was typical, however, we found the croissants were freshly baked. (We were becoming experts on breakfast by now!) I would definately recommend this hotel, particularly if you can get it for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “So, So...”
Reviews.Author: yogibe
Reviews.Content: This was my second and last visit to the hotel. This is a typical older italian hotel. The property is conveniently located about 12-15 minutes by bus to Venice. The hotel location is close the the Mestre town squre which provides nice walking and eating opportunities. There is no gym or room service (contrary to what they say.) The breakfast is adequate. The rooms are nicely decorated but small. I am not a smoker and was given a smoking room as it was the only one available. Normally cigarette smoke doesn't bother my but it somehow got in the room (through the heat ducts?) and was quite obnoxious. We moved to the Marriot Courtyard by the Venice Airport and for the same money got a much nicer new hotel with gym with excellent food and service. Wireless internet at Michelangelo is very expensive. Summary: there are better hotels and values in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for solo or couple”
Reviews.Author: tagliot
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, slightly old fashion (but on the classic side) hotel. Nice, Italian decoration, friednly and helpful staff. Rooms are a little small, but ok for a ouple or solo traveller. Bathroom is realy nice (however, shower only), spacious and convenient. they offer free breakfast, which I did not take (excpet from a dlicious capucino). There is no internet in the room, and relatively expensive connection from a shared computer. which was a donside for me as I was on a business trip. Recommended for a romantic getaway. very easy access to Venice, buy bus.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises.”
Reviews.Author: EugeneFodor
Reviews.Content: This is a nice 4-star hotel. Our room was relatively spacious and clean, and breakfast was decent. However, I must admit that we only spent one night there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good home base for Venice trip”
Reviews.Author: fishinfool329
Reviews.Content: otel is located about 10-15 minutes by car to Venezia. It is a long walk to the train station and the hotel staff suggested we take the bus from a stop several blocks away in order to get to Venice. We decided to drive and were glad for that. We parked in the big parking garage called Tronchetto which connects via the water bus system to anywhere you want to go. The hotel was clean, modern but characteristically small. The San Marco restaurant on the corner outside of the hotel was quite good. The breakfast at the hotel was above average and the staff were friendly. If we go back again we would probably fork over the big bucks to stay in Venice since we were always too tired by late afternoon to enjoy any night time activities in the canal city. Don't forget a stop on Murano to see the glass artisans and creations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorenzo72
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really-really well equipped and above standard. Breakfast was great and large. I definitely enjoyed the stay. 5 minutes away from restaurants and pizzerias in Mestre and well connected by bus to Venice. I would reccomed it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Venice Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay on the outskirts of Venice for the convenience of having our rental car available. This small hotel was in a good location. Quiet neighborhood; walking distance to Maestre shopping and restaurants. The room, lobby, bar very nice. Staff very helpful with the exception of breakfast wait staff (needed and attitude adjustment). Amenites provided in room were above 5 star. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Michelangelo Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Forte Marghera, 69, 30173 Venice, Italy
